newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA CUTS MONTHLY INTEREST RATE TO 20 PCT.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA CUTS MONTHLY INTEREST RATE TO 20 PCT.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) cut the monthly central interest rate to 20 percent from current 25 percent, or 240 percent annually from current 300 percent, the BNB said in a statement.
The new interest rate, effective from October 18, reflects the positive changes in the financial system, said the statement. It did not identify them.
The BNB hiked the central interest rate in September 23 to an all-time high of 300 percent in a bid to stabilise the lev and the financial system.
The BNB also then placed nine banks in receivership and appointed sequestrators to evaluate their state and decide whether to seek their bankruptcy or sell them.
"The package of measures has stabilised the financial system," the BNB said in a statement. The new rate will ease investment in the real economy, it said. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
